intro: Clutia whytei var. whytei, commonly known as the African velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners in warm climates.
